title: People's Vote campaign in chaos after two senior figures pushed out
text:
The People’s Vote campaign has been plunged into chaos by the sacking of two senior figures.

On Sunday night James McGrory, the director, and Tom Baldwin, the head of communications, were forced out of the organisation dedicated to securing a second Brexit referendum.

They duo were asked to leave by Roland Rudd, the outgoing chairman of Open Britain, one of five organisations that make up the People's Vote campaign.

The sacked pair, however, defiantly turned up at work this morning, with Mr Baldwin accusing Mr Rudd of “making a mistake” and taking a "wrecking ball" to the campaign.

He said this morning: “Roland Rudd has told me not to go into work today but the thing is, I don’t work for Roland...
description: The People’s Vote campaign has been plunged into chaos by the sacking of two senior figures.
